sub_topic: Calculation of efficiency of a refrigerator
message_1: A refrigerator removes heat from its interior at a rate of 200 J/s and discharges it to the surroundings at a rate of 300 J/s. If the work required to operate the refrigerator is 150 J/s, what is the efficiency of the refrigerator?
message_2:
The efficiency of a refrigerator is given by the Coefficient of Performance (COP), which is the ratio of the heat removed from the interior (Q_c) to the work done by the refrigerator (W).

COP = Q_c / W

In this case, the heat removed from the interior (Q_c) is 200 J/s, and the work done by the refrigerator (W) is 150 J/s.

COP = 200 J/s / 150 J/s = 4/3 â‰ˆ 1.33

The efficiency of the refrigerator is 1.33 or 133%.
